casebody.data:
Dallis F. COOMER, Movant/Appellant,
v.
STATE of Missouri, Respondent. No. ED 106918 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION TWO. FILED: June 11, 2019
Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied July 22, 2019 ATTORNEY FOR APPELLANT: Maleaner Ryna Harvey, Office of the State Court Public Defender, 1010 Market, Suite 1100, St. Louis, MO 63101. ATTORNEY FOR RESPONDENT: Eric Schmitt, Attorney General, Karen Louise Kramer, Assistant Attorney General, P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102. Before Philip M. Hess, P.J., Robert G. Dowd, Jr., J., and Mary K. Hoff, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM

Dallis F. Coomer appeals from the "Judgment and Order" denying, without an evidentiary hearing, his "Amended Motion to Vacate, Set Aside, or Correct Judgment and Sentence and Request for Evidentiary Hearing" for post-conviction relief pursuant to Rule 24.035. We affirm.

We have reviewed the briefs of the parties, the legal file, and the record on appeal and find the claims of error to be without merit. No error of law appears. An extended opinion reciting the detailed facts and restating the principles of law applicable to this case would serve no jurisprudential or precedential purpose. We have, however, provided a memorandum opinion for the use of the parties setting forth the reasons for our decision. We affirm the Judgment pursuant to Rule 84.16(b).
